entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Thunderstorms are expected in many regions of the South Island today, bringing the risk of localised heavy rain of 10 to 25 mm/h, and hail 5 to 20 mm in diameter. In the east of the South Island, about the Canterbury plains and foothills about and south of Rakaia, through eastern Otago to Clutha, there is a moderate risk SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS could develop from early afternoon, producing large hail greater than 20 mm in diameter, or large accumulations of hail.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, as well as make driving conditions hazardous.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 04:07 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near ASHBURTON, LONGBEACH and THE ASHBURTON RIVER MOUTH.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the eastnortheast, and are expected to lie near THE ASHBURTON RIVER MOUTH and SEAFIELD at 04:37 pm and near OFFSHORE RAKAIA RIVER MOUTH at 05:07 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by very heavy rain and large hail.
Impact:
Very heavy rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, and make driving conditions hazardous.
